channel.title: Need your website approved? [Updated]
channel.description:
All website advertising on this forum must be preapproved by a moderator. There were no exact grounds as to how this worked, until now. If you want your website to be approved for posting, simply post your request application in this board and discuss it with the staff. We will either approve or deny your request and you will know why we made our decision (since you will be able to see the mass majority of our discussion).
All previously approved websites prior to the creation of this board are no longer approved. They must be sent back through this system before they can be approved.
[b]Update: [/b]Only websites related to rsps development need to be approved. General websites such as github, pastebin, google, youtube, and any other website not related and not censored may be posted freely. This is not to say you can just post a topic advertising it, though (unless it's entirely relevant). This last part depends on per-section rules.
Post any concerns you have for this system in this topic. Thank you!
The MoparScape Staff

item.description:
@Dunder_Mifflin1 wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:3, topic:444074”]There has always been unwritten “law” on the boards that you can post websites related to your developments if it’s first approved by a global moderator (moparscape mods are included in this). This was an ineffective system, so we are trying another way of handling website requests. You can post them in here and argue why they should be approved and, if they are, you are free to use them in your signature(s) and on your development post. Otherwise, you may be infracted for advertising if it’s not approved.

Does that answer your question Loveandpower?[/quote]

no such thing as an unwritten law. Statement is invalid. get raped. im scared cause your an admin. inb4ban

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

TimeRS3:

Let’s say I ask a mod that I want to approve a site if the site is about runescape hosts my server and also sells staff would that be still eligible to approve I already have mine approved but I would like to make sure

Elligible, sure. It would still require discussion though, especially regarding selling staff spots.

item.title: Need your website approved? [Updated]
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“hornyhamster, post:17, topic:444074”]So… Essentially you guys can just deny any servers you don’t like now… and make the small amount of rsc servers advertised even smaller…

Yet the Rs2 Community can post all sorts of crap on the server status pages without regulation.

Sounds fair to me +1[/quote]

Not quite. The website approval concept existed before this board did, yet it wasn’t enforced well on the RSC side. It’s not too big of an issue right now, either way. We are going to discuss the idea of approving websites in much greater detail in the coming weeks, so don’t be too focused on any sort of ‘hidden motives’ you think exist behind this board.

Furthermore, if you have any suggestions or concerns about how this board is run, feel free to post a topic in it and we’ll discuss it privately.

Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Need your website approved? [Updated]
item.dc:creator: @hornyhamster hornyhamster
item.description:
@hornyhamster wrote:

So… Essentially you guys can just deny any servers you don’t like now… and make the small amount of rsc servers advertised even smaller…

Yet the Rs2 Community can post all sorts of crap on the server status pages without regulation.

item.title: Need your website approved? [Updated]
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:15, topic:444074”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=546756.msg4008818#msg4008818 date=1338937609]

There has always been unwritten “law” on the boards that you can post websites related to your developments if it’s first approved by a global moderator (moparscape mods are included in this). This was an ineffective system, so we are trying another way of handling website requests. You can post them in here and argue why they should be approved and, if they are, you are free to use them in your signature(s) and on your development post. Otherwise, you may be infracted for advertising if it’s not approved.

Does that answer your question Loveandpower?

what about sites that have nothing to do with rsps devel/don’t attract a community base?

I think I can safely say those are openly allowed. We only care about websites that are relevant to this community’s theme of rsps development. If you have some site for funny irc logs, you’re at your own liberty of using it. Same goes with things like youtube, google, etc.
[/quote]
clarifying ‘community’ websites as being prohibited would be a lot more clear (people may ask about blogs/github/googlecode/etc), i sort of knew your answer - i just wanted to aid other users in understanding the rules[/quote]

I updated it. Thanks for the suggestion.

Read full topic
